1.text: Now Saul was in full agreement with Stephen’s death. At that time, a great persecution arose against the Church which was in Jerusalem. The disciples were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.

2.text: Devout men buried Stephen and greatly lamented over him.

3.text: In the meantime, Saul was ravaging the Church, entering into every house and dragging both men and women off to prison.

4.text: As a result, those who had been scattered abroad began to travel around, preaching the word.

5.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed Christ to them.

6.text: When the people heard and saw the signs which Philip was accomplishing, they agreed to listen to what he was preaching.

7.text: (Indeed, unclean spirits were expelled from many of those who had them, and they came out shouting with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed,

8.text: and there was great joy in that city).

9.text: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who used to practice sorcery in the city. He amazed the people of Samaria, claiming to be a great one,

10.text: and all listened to him, from the least to the greatest. They said, “This man is the great power of God!”

11.text: People listened to him because for a long time, he had amazed them with his sorceries.

12.text: But when they believed Philip [who was] preaching good tidings, the things concerning the Kingdom of God, and the Name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

13.text: Simon himself also believed and after his baptism, he followed Philip closely. Seeing that miracles and signs were taking place, he was amazed.

14.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

15.text: When they arrived, they prayed for the people, so that they might receive [the] Holy Spirit

16.text: because the Holy Spirit had not yet come upon any of them. (They had only been baptized in the Name of the Lord Jesus).

17.text: Then Peter and John laid their hands on them, and they received [the] Holy Spirit.

18.text: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,

19.text: saying, “Give me this power also, so that whoever I lay my hands on may receive [the] Holy Spirit!”

20.text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

21.text: You have no part or share in this {ministry} because your heart is not right before God.

22.text: Repent of this wickedness of yours and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.

23.text: Indeed, I see that you are in the poison of bitterness and in the bondage of wickedness!”

24.text: Simon answered, “Pray for me to God, that none of the things which you have spoken [may] happen to me.”

25.text: After Peter and John had borne witness and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem and {on their way} preached the Good News in many villages of the Samaritans.

26.text: Then an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Arise, and go toward the south, to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desert.”

27.text: So Philip arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians. He was in charge of all her treasure and had come to Jerusalem to express adoration.

28.text: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and reading the prophet Isaias (Isaiah).

29.text: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go near, and join yourself to this chariot.”

30.text: Philip ran to the eunuch and heard him reading Isaias (Isaiah) the prophet. He asked, “Do you understand what you are reading?”

31.text: The man replied, “How can I, unless someone explains it to me?” He then begged Philip to come up and sit with him.

32.text: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this:  He was led as a sheep to the slaughter.   As a lamb before his shearer is silent, so he does not open his mouth.

33.text: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away.   And who will declare His generation?   For his life is taken from the earth.

34.text: The eunuch asked Philip, “Who is the prophet talking about? About himself, or about someone else?”

35.text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, he proclaimed {the Good News about} Jesus to this man.

36.text: As they went on the way, they came to [a place with] some water, and the eunuch said, “Behold, here is water! What is keeping me from being baptized?”

37.text: Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” The man answered, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God!”

38.text: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.

39.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away. The eunuch did not see him any more and went on his way rejoicing.

40.text: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through [that area], he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he reached Caesarea.
